meanings.definition: Showing an aggressive or assertive attitude in trying to get what one wants.
meanings.sent1: She is the pushiest player on the team, always trying to take control of the game.
meanings.sent2: The pushiest salesperson at the store always manages to convince customers to buy more than they planned.
meanings.sent3: The pushiest squirrel in the park kept stealing nuts from the other animals, thinking it was the nut queen.
meanings.sent4: Her pushiest behavior in the negotiation room was like a bulldozer, flattening any objections in her path.
meanings.sent5: The pushiest waves crashed against the shore, determined to erode the cliffs over time.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a tendency to push oneself forward in a forceful or insistent manner.
meanings.sent1: He was the pushiest candidate during the job interview, making sure his qualifications were heard loud and clear.
meanings.sent2: The pushiest child in the class always raised their hand first to answer any question.
meanings.sent3: The pushiest cloud in the sky seemed to be in a rush, trying to beat the others in a race across the horizon.
meanings.sent4: The pushiest flower in the garden stretched its petals towards the sun, eager for its warmth and light.
meanings.sent5: The pushiest engine roared to life, ready to propel the rocket into space.
